Aggregated trajectory: speed of convergence#

Dans ce tuto, nous voudrions analyser l’effet de la distance d’appariement dans l’algorithme de fusion. Nous allons focaliser surtout avec la distance de Fréchet et la distance DTW-L2.

Pour cela, nous allons générer plusieurs échantillons d’un certain nombre de trajectoires de trajectoire et calculé la qualité entre les deux traces.

Realistic Synthetic GNSS Trajectories: These simulated trajectories provide a controlled environment to test the algorithm’s performance under various predefined conditions, allowing us to assess its accuracy and robustness;

Reference:[1] - SIGSPATIAL 2024

As usual, let’s start by defining our environment#

1/ The first task is only useful for the online notebook and import the local tracklib code source. This script is not necessary if tracklib is installed from PyPI.

[2]:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import os.path
import sys

#-------------------------------------------------------
# Import de tracklib
module_path = os.path.abspath(os.path.join('../../..'))
if module_path not in sys.path:
    sys.path.append(module_path)

import tracklib as tkl

2/ The following imports are necessary for the tutorial.

[3]:

import csv
import math
import numpy as np

# For
from random import randint

# For plotting
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.pyplot import cm

3/ Let’s define two functions to plot results: (i) visualizeAggTraj: display the track reference and aggregated tracks

[4]:

color = cm.rainbow(np.linspace(0, 1, 25))

def visualizeAggTraj(i, N=3, track=None, tracks=None, title=None):
    '''
    '''
    ax = plt.subplot2grid((1,N), (0,i))

    if tracks != None and isinstance(tracks, tkl.TrackCollection):
        for (i, t) in enumerate(tracks):
            ax.plot(t.getX(), t.getY(), c=color[i])

    if tracks != None and isinstance(tracks, tkl.Track):
        central = tracks
        ax.plot(central.getX(), central.getY(), 'c-')

    ax.plot(track.getX(), track.getY(), 'k-')
    if title != None:
        ax.set_title(title)
    ax.set_xlabel('')
    ax.set_ylabel('Y')
    ax.grid()

  1. plotEvolution écart entre la trace aggrégée and the raw trajectory suivant la taille de l’échantillon

[5]:

def plotEvolution(X, YF1, YD1, YF2, YD2, YF3, YD3):
    plt.figure(figsize=(15, 3))
    plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8, wspace=0.2, hspace=0.5)

    ax1 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,0))
    ax1.plot(X, YF1, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
    ax1.plot(X, YD1, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
    ax1.set_xlabel('sample size')
    ax1.set_ylabel("RMSE")
    ax1.set_title('Almost straight')
    ax1.legend()

    ax2 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,1))
    ax2.plot(X, YF2, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
    ax2.plot(X, YD2, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
    ax2.set_xlabel('sample size')
    ax2.set_ylabel("RMSE")
    ax2.set_title('Moderate sinuosity')
    ax2.legend()

    ax3 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,2))
    ax3.plot(X, YF3, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
    ax3.plot(X, YD3, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
    ax3.set_xlabel('sample size')
    ax3.set_ylabel("RMSE")
    ax3.set_title('Switchbacks')
    ax3.legend()

    plt.show()

Create 3 commonly mountain path shapes#

For this experimentation, we will examine the trajectory aggregation process for different types of paths to be reconstructed. In the context of mountain hiking, we identified three characteristic path shapes: nearly straight segments, moderately sinuosity road segments, and a zigzagging path composed of a series of switchbacks. To maintain shape consistency throughout the entire road segment, the generated trajectories have a length of approximately 300 meters.

[6]:

tkl.seed(123)

# ----------------------------------------------------------
# Generate the path 'Almost straight'
sentier1 = tkl.generate(0.5, dt=10)[::3]
sentier1.scale(5)

# ----------------------------------------------------------
sentier2 = tkl.generate(0.1, dt=10)[::3]

# ----------------------------------------------------------
base_lacets = tkl.generate(0.4, dt=10)
sentier3 = tkl.noise(base_lacets, 20, tkl.SincKernel(20),
                    direction=tkl.MODE_DIRECTION_ORTHO)[::3]
sentier3.scale(4)

# ----------------------------------------------------------
# Plot
print ('')
plt.figure(figsize=(15, 3))
plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8, wspace=0.2, hspace=0.5)

visualizeAggTraj(0, track=sentier1, title='Almost straight')
visualizeAggTraj(1, track=sentier2, title='Moderate sinuosity')
visualizeAggTraj(2, track=sentier2, title='Switchbacks')

# plt.suptitle(title)
plt.show()
# visualizeAggTraj(sentier1, sentier2, sentier3)

Generated track from 05/02/2042 00:44:56 to 05/02/2042 01:44:56 [360 pts, 64.1m]
Generated track from 10/10/1982 08:02:44 to 10/10/1982 09:02:44 [360 pts, 297.54m]
Generated track from 25/11/2004 23:29:18 to 26/11/2004 00:29:18 [360 pts, 79.85m]

Create sets of simulated GNSS trajectories#

In the experimentation detailled in [1], trajectories have been generated with a 5 m-amplitude exponential covariance process, completed by a 1 m white noise process, a 50 cm range Gaussian Process for referencement error.

[1]:

N = 15

# ----------------------------------------------------------
# Generate xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx 'Almost straight'
# expkernel = tkl.ExponentialKernel(100)
# tracks1.noise(5, expkernel)
tracks1 = tkl.core.TrackCollection([sentier1]*N)
tracks1.noise(1, tkl.ExponentialKernel(100))
tracks1.noise(0, tkl.GaussianKernel(1000))

Create aggregated trajectory#

Pour plusieurs sets de traces: 1 à 15 prises au hasard dans le lot généré ci-dessus. On calcule Fréchet et DTW-L2.

Ce calcul prend du temps !

[7]:

E = 4
FRECHET = {'Almost straight': [], 'Moderate sinuosity': [], 'Switchbacks': []}
DTW = {'Almost straight': [], 'Moderate sinuosity': [], 'Switchbacks': []}

represent_method = tkl.MODE_REP_BARYCENTRE
agg_method = tkl.MODE_AGG_MEDIAN
constraint = False
master = tkl.MODE_MASTER_MEDIAN_LEN
itermax = 25

for s in range(1, E+1):
    print ('Sample size: ', s)
    # create set
    TAB = set()
    while len(TAB) <= s:
        n = randint(0, N-1)
        TAB.add(n)

    sets1 = tkl.TrackCollection()
    sets2 = tkl.TrackCollection()
    sets3 = tkl.TrackCollection()
    for idx in TAB:
        sets1.addTrack(tracks1[idx])
        sets2.addTrack(tracks2[idx])
        sets3.addTrack(tracks3[idx])

    # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Fréchet
    p = float('inf')
    mode = tkl.MODE_MATCHING_FRECHET
    print ('    FRECHET')

    central1 = tkl.fusion(tracks1, master=master, dim=2, mode=mode, p=p, represent_method=represent_method,  agg_method=agg_method,
                         constraint=constraint, verbose=False, iter_max = itermax)
    FRECHET['Almost straight'].append(central1)

    central2 = tkl.fusion(tracks2, master=master, dim=2, mode=mode, p=p, represent_method=represent_method,  agg_method=agg_method,
                         constraint=constraint, verbose=False, iter_max = itermax)
    FRECHET['Moderate sinuosity'].append(central2)

    central3 = tkl.fusion(tracks3, master=master, dim=2, mode=mode, p=p, represent_method=represent_method,  agg_method=agg_method,
                         constraint=constraint, verbose=False, iter_max = itermax)
    FRECHET['Switchbacks'].append(central3)

    # ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
    # DTW
    p = 2
    mode = tkl.MODE_MATCHING_DTW
    print ('    DTW')

    central1 = tkl.fusion(sets1, master=master, dim=2, mode=mode, p=p, represent_method=represent_method,  agg_method=agg_method,
                         constraint=constraint, verbose=False, iter_max = itermax)
    DTW['Almost straight'].append(central1)

    central2 = tkl.fusion(sets2, master=master, dim=2, mode=mode, p=p, represent_method=represent_method,  agg_method=agg_method,
                         constraint=constraint, verbose=False, iter_max = itermax)
    DTW['Moderate sinuosity'].append(central2)

    central3 = tkl.fusion(sets3, master=master, dim=2, mode=mode, p=p, represent_method=represent_method,  agg_method=agg_method,
                         constraint=constraint, verbose=False, iter_max = itermax)
    DTW['Switchbacks'].append(central3)

# On imprime les résultats pour toutes les fusions

centralsF1 = tkl.TrackCollection()
centralsF2 = tkl.TrackCollection()
centralsF3 = tkl.TrackCollection()
for s in range(0, E):
    central1 = FRECHET['Almost straight'][s]
    centralsF1.addTrack(central1)
    central2 = FRECHET['Moderate sinuosity'][s]
    centralsF2.addTrack(central2)
    central3 = FRECHET['Switchbacks'][s]
    centralsF3.addTrack(central3)
# visualizeAggTraj(sentier1, sentier2, sentier3, centrals1, centrals2, centrals3, title='FRECHET')

centralsD2 = tkl.TrackCollection()
centralsD3 = tkl.TrackCollection()
for s in range(0, E):
    central1 = DTW['Almost straight'][s]
    centralsD1.addTrack(central1)
    central2 = DTW['Moderate sinuosity'][s]
    centralsD2.addTrack(central2)
    central3 = DTW['Switchbacks'][s]
    centralsD3.addTrack(central3)
# visualizeAggTraj(sentier1, sentier2, sentier3, centrals1, centrals2, centrals3, title='DTW')

plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8, wspace=0.2, hspace=0.5)

for i in range(0, E):
    ax = plt.subplot2grid((1,E), (0,i))
    c = centralsF2[i]
    ax.plot(c.getX(), c.getY(), label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
    c = centralsD2[i]
    ax.plot(c.getX(), c.getY(), label="DTW", color="tab:green")
    ax.plot(sentier2.getX(), sentier2.getY(), 'k-')

Mesure l’écart en position#

Le résultat est l’erreur RMSE pointwise (en m) entre les 2 trajectoires ré-échantillonnées en 1000 points.

[ ]:

def rmse(central, sentier):
    central.resample(npts=1000, mode=2)
    sentier.resample(npts=1000, mode=2)

    rmse = 0
    for i in range(999):
        dx = sentier[i].position.distance2DTo(central[i].position)
        rmse += dx*dx
    rmse = math.sqrt(rmse/999)

    return rmse

TSS = []
T1F=[]; T2F=[]; T3F=[]
T1D=[]; T2D=[]; T3D=[]
for s in range(0, E):
    TSS.append(s+1)

    central1 = FRECHET['Almost straight'][s]
    vrmse = rmse(central1, sentier1)
    T1F.append(vrmse)

    central2 = FRECHET['Moderate sinuosity'][s]
    vrmse = rmse(central2, sentier2)
    T2F.append(vrmse)

    central3 = FRECHET['Switchbacks'][s]
    vrmse = rmse(central3, sentier3)
    T3F.append(vrmse)

    central1 = DTW['Almost straight'][s]
    vrmse = rmse(central1, sentier1)
    T1D.append(vrmse)

    central2 = DTW['Moderate sinuosity'][s]
    vrmse = rmse(central2, sentier2)
    T2D.append(vrmse)

    central3 = DTW['Switchbacks'][s]
    vrmse = rmse(central3, sentier3)
    T3D.append(vrmse)


plt.figure(figsize=(15, 3))
plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8, wspace=0.2, hspace=0.5)

ax1 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,0))
ax1.plot(TSS, T1D, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
ax1.plot(TSS, T1F, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
ax1.set_xlabel('sample size')
ax1.set_ylabel("RMSE")
ax1.set_title('Almost straight')
ax1.legend()

ax2 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,1))
ax2.plot(TSS, T2D, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
ax2.plot(TSS, T2F, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
ax2.set_xlabel('sample size')
ax2.set_ylabel("RMSE")
ax2.set_title('Moderate sinuosity')
ax2.legend()

ax3 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,2))
ax3.plot(TSS, T3D, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
ax3.plot(TSS, T3F, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
ax3.set_xlabel('sample size')
ax3.set_ylabel("RMSE")
ax3.set_title('Switchbacks')
ax3.legend()

plt.show()

Mesure l’écart en forme#

On recale les deux trajectoires pour aligner la fusion sur le jeu de vérité terrain de vincennes, et ne comparer ainsi que les écarts de formes.

[ ]:

TSS = []
T1F=[]; T2F=[]; T3F=[]
T1D=[]; T2D=[]; T3D=[]
for s in range(0, E):
    TSS.append(s+1)

    central1 = FRECHET['Almost straight'][s]
    tkl.mapping.mapOn(central1, sentier1, verbose=False)
    vrmse = rmse(central1, sentier1)
    T1F.append(vrmse)

    central2 = FRECHET['Moderate sinuosity'][s]
    tkl.mapping.mapOn(central2, sentier2, verbose=False)
    vrmse = rmse(central2, sentier2)
    T2F.append(vrmse)

    central3 = FRECHET['Switchbacks'][s]
    tkl.mapping.mapOn(central3, sentier3, verbose=False)
    vrmse = rmse(central3, sentier3)
    T3F.append(vrmse)

    central1 = DTW['Almost straight'][s]
    tkl.mapping.mapOn(central1, sentier1, verbose=False)
    vrmse = rmse(central1, sentier1)
    T1D.append(vrmse)

    central2 = DTW['Moderate sinuosity'][s]
    tkl.mapping.mapOn(central2, sentier2, verbose=False)
    vrmse = rmse(central2, sentier2)
    T2D.append(vrmse)

    central3 = DTW['Switchbacks'][s]
    tkl.mapping.mapOn(central3, sentier3, verbose=False)
    vrmse = rmse(central3, sentier3)
    T3D.append(vrmse)


plt.figure(figsize=(15, 3))
plt.subplots_adjust(top=0.8, wspace=0.2, hspace=0.5)

ax1 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,0))
ax1.plot(TSS, T1D, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
ax1.plot(TSS, T1F, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
ax1.set_xlabel('sample size')
ax1.set_ylabel("RMSE")
ax1.set_title('Almost straight')
ax1.legend()

ax2 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,1))
ax2.plot(TSS, T2D, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
ax2.plot(TSS, T2F, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
ax2.set_xlabel('sample size')
ax2.set_ylabel("RMSE")
ax2.set_title('Moderate sinuosity')
ax2.legend()

ax3 = plt.subplot2grid((1,3), (0,2))
ax3.plot(TSS, T3D, label="Fréchet", color="tab:orange")
ax3.plot(TSS, T3F, label="DTW", color="tab:green")
ax3.set_xlabel('sample size')
ax3.set_ylabel("RMSE")
ax3.set_title('Switchbacks')
ax3.legend()

plt.show()

#plotResult(sentier1, sentier2, sentier3, central1, central2, central3)
On this page
  • As usual, let’s start by defining our environment
  • Create 3 commonly mountain path shapes
  • Create sets of simulated GNSS trajectories
  • Create aggregated trajectory
  • Mesure l’écart en position
  • Mesure l’écart en forme
